While Black Friday officially falls on November 29, plenty of retailers have jumped the gun and are already offering incredible price cuts. That’s especially true of Best Buy and Amazon--both of which are slashing prices on a long list of popular Logitech gaming mice. These run the gamut from affordable models to ultra-premium models, so whether you need something for competitive online gaming or simply chopping trees in RuneScape, now is a great time to upgrade your PC gaming setup.

One of our favorite deals is for the Logitech G305 Lightspeed Wireless Gaming Mouse, as it’s now just $28.50 (was $50). That’s just a few bucks shy of its lowest price ever, and its lightweight design and six programmable buttons make it a good companion for most games. With a staggering 250 hours of gameplay on a single AA battery, a total weight of 99 grams, and a Hero Gaming Sensor that supports 400 IPS and up to 12,000 DPI, it’s a pretty great deal. Be sure to clip the coupon on its store page before checkout to see the full discount.

Need something more extreme? Step up to the Logitech G502 X Wireless Gaming Mouse. On sale for $95 (was $140), this is the lowest price ever for the competitive gaming mouse. Lightforce switches offer good reliability and are quick to actuate each click, the Hero 25K sensor should be highly responsive, and its dual mode scroll wheel lets you spin it freely for rapid inputs or enable a precision ratcheting mode.

Other deals include the Logitech G502 X Wired Gaming Mouse for $48 (was $80), the Logitech G Pro Wireless Gaming Mouse for $70 (was $130), and the Logitech G903 Wireless Gaming Mouse for $90 (was $130). Deals are available at both Amazon and Best Buy, so be sure to check both catalogs if you don’t see anything that catches your eye in our list below.

item.title: Life Is Strange: Double Exposure Has A Nice Black Friday Discount
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/life-is-strange-double-exposure-has-a-nice-black-friday-discount/1100-6527974/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Black Friday shopping season has begun, and it's not just Amazon that has video games on sale. Best Buy is running its own Black Friday sale, and one of its offers is $10 off Life is Strange: Double Exposure.

The game, which was only just released a few weeks ago, is marked down to just $40 right now across PS5 and Xbox Series X|S.

Double Exposure continues the story of Max Caulfield as she attends Caledon University. It's bad news right away, though, as she finds her friend, Safi, lying dead in the snow after being murdered.

Using her powers, Max creates a parallel timeline in which Safi is still alive, but unfortunately for her, the killer wants her dead in that timeline as well. The hook in Double Exposure is that Max can shift between timelines in an attempt to stop the murders in both timelines.

GameSpot's Double Exposure review scored the game a 6/10. The game is the latest in the main series and was released in October 2024 from developer Deck Nine.

Best Buy's own Black Friday sale has lots of great deals, including discounts on numerous other video games (like CFB 2025 for $30), big-screen TVs for under $200, soundbars, and lots more.

item.title: Day-One Game Pass Launch Stalker 2 Crosses Major Sales Milestone
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/day-one-game-pass-launch-stalker-2-crosses-major-sales-milestone/1100-6527971/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl launched on November 20 after years of development, and it seems to be off to a solid start. Developer GSC Game World announced that the first-person survival game has cleared 1 million copies sold across PC and Xbox, but that doesn't tell the entire story of how many people have played it.

In its statement, GSC said that in addition to the 1 million sales, "much more stalkers" have joined in thanks to Game Pass. The studio did not specify how many people are playing on Game Pass, however.

There is an ongoing discussion about whether or not releasing on Game Pass at launch negatively impacts sales. There are no definitive answers, and every game is different. For Stalker 2, we don't know anything about the budget, sales projections, break-even points, or anything else. Whether or not 1 million sales for Stalker 2 is a good number is unknown, but it's something that GSC is celebrating publicly.

No wonder it feels a bit crowdy in the Zone. A million copies were sold, and much more stalkers joined the artifact hunt with Game Pass.
This is just the start of our unforgettable adventure. The Heart of Chornobyl emanates stronger with each of us.
Thank You, stalkers! ☢️ pic.twitter.com/zslF7I8vR1

— S.T.A.L.K.E.R. OFFICIAL (@stalker_thegame) November 22, 2024

Stalker 2 is the first entry in the series since 2009's Call of Pripyat, so there was seemingly a good amount of pent-up demand for the next Stalker game. It's had a long and bumpy road to release, as Stalker 2 was originally announced to release all the way back in 2012. The game was in fact canceled in 2012, but later reemerged and was eventually made using Epic's Unreal Engine 5.

Stalker 2 was later reassigned a 2022 release date, but the game's development was halted following Russia's invasion of Ukraine, where the studio has offices. It later shifted to September 2024 before getting delayed once more to November 20, a date that stuck.

In addition to being available for outright purchase, Stalker 2 is available as part of Game Pass Ultimate and PC Game Pass. For more, check out some of the other Game Pass titles arriving this month in the gallery below.

For more, check out GameSpot's Stalker 2 review and our Stalker 2 guides hub.
